private_information: Can interact only with vowel blocks: A, E, I
Can hold at most one block at a time
Can only pick up the top block of any stack
Cannot place a block on top of a block currently held by either agent
Aware of global constraints: max 3 stacks on table
vowel_agent.goal: Help reorganize blocks so final stacks match the specified goal configuration while only manipulating vowel blocks.

private_information: Can interact only with consonant blocks: B, C, D, F, G
Can hold at most one block at a time
Can only pick up the top block of any stack
Cannot place a block on top of a block currently held by either agent
Aware of global constraints: max 3 stacks on table
consonant_agent.goal: Help reorganize blocks so final stacks match the specified goal configuration while only manipulating consonant blocks.

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that models the two-agent vowel/consonant block-stacking task and coordinates actions subject to all constraints.

init.access_rule: Only top block of a stack can be picked

public_information: There are two initial stacks on the table
At most 3 stacks may exist on the table at any time
Blocks can only be accessed from the top of a stack
Agents may hold at most one block at a time
An agent cannot place a block on top of a block currently held by either agent
Final configuration must exactly match the goal stacks
Vowel-agent can only move A, E, I
Consonant-agent can only move B, C, D, F, G

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling. You will be provided the environment initial state, the goal, public facts, and each agent's private constraints. Produce a PDDL domain and problem that models the block-stacking task with two agents (vowel_agent and consonant_agent) and enforces all constraints exactly. Distinguish actions by agent (e.g., pick-vowel, place-consonant). Ensure at-most-one-held-per-agent, top-only access, category-based permissions, prohibition on placing onto a block currently held, and the max number of stacks constraint are encoded. Output only the domain and problem enclosed in <domain>...</domain> and <problem>...</problem> tags respectively.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The vowel_agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->vowel_agent->private_information}.
The consonant_agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->consonant_agent->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
